descriptionHtml:
[u][size=6]Overview[/size]
[/u]
So I'm a big fan of Skyrim and have always loved the modding community and the mods they make which we all get to enjoy. However as with any mod there can always be issues which come up while using them and in several cases the mod author has moved on to other things and doesn't seem to circle back around to their mods again. So I've taken it on as a personal project to try and fix these issues with the mods myself and the combination of them I'm running in my own play through. If the mod author is still active I'll send them a message to let them know of any issues and fixes, but in cases where they've moved on I'll usually just fix it myself and upload the patches here for others to try out and report issues.

In any case this is my attempt to try and get my own collection of mods to work without issue so the patches may or may not work for your configuration depending on what you're running. In most all cases I will try to make sure that the patches fix issues only with that particular mod and don't cause any new conflicts or dependencies.

I will only be taking on fixes for mods that I'm running in my current play through so feel free to post issues with those so I can take a look as I may have not run into them myself in my own game. Though if I can reproduce it I'll definitely be trying to fix it.

However for mods not listed here I won't be making patches as I'm not using them in my current play through.

Additionally any other patches created by other players that I've installed to fix issues I'll be linking to in the other mod patches section.

The hope is that this page can become a resource for getting a stable version of Skyrim running with all the mods and versions I run myself by using these patches along with other users patches to make it stable.



[size=6][u]My Mod Patches[/u][/size]

This section includes information of patches for mods linked to in the files page that were created by me. Any mods listed below I am currently playing with installed and found and issue which I tried to fix via patching the ESP or fixing the Papyrus scripts directly. After fixing the issue and creating a patch I'll install it and play with it as well to try and continue to weed out any issues. Eating my own dog food so to speak. I'll try to keep the information about these patches up to date here in the main page as well as in the forums as the issues come up.


[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16225/]Apocalypse - Magic of Skyrim[/url] by EnaiSiaion[/size]

[color=#00ff00]Patch 1.0 - Fixed issue causing papyrus log errors about "Cannot add form None to leveled list" by adding a check on the form variable prior to calling the add to list function.[/color]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31822/]
Deadly Headshots 2.0[/url] by mercuito[/size]

Original Patch [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61601/]Here[/url]

[color=#00ff00]Patch 1.2 - Rewrote and compiled the cooldown effect pex from scratch due to errors about magic number in papyrus log.
Patch 1.1 - Removed an invalid reference to ValidSpellProjectiles array that the ESP had to one of the collision box scripts.
Patch 1.0 - Modified ESP and script for 180s cooldown on Deadly Focus ability.[/color]


[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61255/?]Immersive Lighting of NPCs[/url][/size][size=4] by Versonshu
[/size]
Original Patch [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62178/]Here[/url]

[color=#00ff00]Patch 1.1 - Added more check for none object type before calling to GetEquippedItemType() or running long sequence of checks that required the actor object.
Patch 1.0 - Fixed papyrus log errors about calling HasKeyword on none object.[/color]

[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23600/]
Player Headtracking[/url] by Maegfaer[/size]

Original Patch [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61639/]Here[/url]

[color=#00ff00]Patch 1.2 - Removed accidental dependency on DLCs.
Patch 1.1 - Fixed issue with werewolves pointed out by timebomb and added crosshair headtracking.
Patch 1.0 - Fix for papyrus log spam, possible break in head tracking, and implemented no corpses check.[/color]


[size=4][u][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25022/]Shooting Stars[/url][/u] by isoku[/size]

[color=#00ff00]Patch 1.0 - Increases size of meteor nif objects so they're more visible in the sky when playing with ENB.
[/color]


[size=6][u]Other Mod Patches[/u][/size]

This section includes information of patches for mods created by other users that I am using in conjunction with the patches listed above created by me. The patches listed below are hyperlinked to direct you to the original patch authors page.

[u][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59849/][size=4]Perkus Maximus[/size][/url][/u][size=4] by T3nd0[/size]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60244]
[color=#00ff00][size=2]xMAWARCombatLogic Quick fix - ALPHA[/size][/color][/url][color=#00ff00][size=2] v1.2[/size][/color][size=2] by Gnaul[/size]



[u][size=6]Installed Mod List[/size][/u]

This section contains a list of all the current mods and versions I'm running for my play through that these patches are applicable to. Please bare with me as I fill out this section with all the information on these mods and the bashes I created from many of them in an attempt to get everything I wanted in under the 255 mod limit. I've broken them into install sections that I used when building my Skyrim installation to try and test things out and keep them organized as  I went along installing them. The naming convention on the sections is just to keep them ordered and organized inside NMM in the order I installed them.

Bare with me while I fill this out and try to link to all the mods.

[u][size=6]My Mods[/size][/u]

Mods that I've created for my play through that adjust game mechanics or add things that I wanted in the game. These are just personal preference so they definitely aren't meant for everybody.


[size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61450/?]Improved Swimming[/url][/size] - Adds speed, stamina, and health drain effects while swimming based on current inventory weight vs. carrying capacity.
author: NaughtyColt
